website_summaries.verdict: ClimaShield Plus fabric technology protects your bike from the elements, while the vent system prevents build up condensation and mildew.
pros: Heavy-duty 300 Denier polyester provides extra moisture resistance, fabric breathability and fade resistance, while the marine grade aluminized triple-coating eliminates any melting if cover touches hot engines or mufflers
Sewn in soft cotton part prevents scratching the windscreen
cons: It may let in some water during heavy rain

customer_reviews.title: Not a well made product.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the craftsmanship of this product. It came highly recommended and more expensive than some of the other ones. I had to return this product twice because both had issues with the stitching on the bottom. See pictures attached. It's a brand new product the stitching shouldn't be coming undone. I bought the Amazon basics cover instead which was less than half the price and seems better made. I will never give another penny to Guardian products.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Melted plastic/Attract rats
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to spend hours on removing melted plastic on your pipes do not buy this cover. I am very disappointed in this purchase I do not recommend, also I noticed it's been chewed by rats .... I have never seen rats around my apartment and I live in a gated new property.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: ordered this cover back in may 2017. this cover works great and keeps my bike dry outside. the motorcycle is not under a roof and the only thing protecting this bike is the cover. the cover holds up really well. and is still functional. keeps the bike nice and clean. the only issues I have is the many strands of thread that hang at the bungee the snugs the cover to the bike at the bottom. other than that I highly recommend this cover for people who dont have a space to store the bike. although I do not know how it holds up to winter weather as I store my bike at someone's garage during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: todd johnston

customer_reviews.title: Large Size Cover Fits a Kawasaki Concours Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Large size cover to replace an XL Dowco Guardian cover I purchased last year which was too big for my Kawasaki Concours motorcycle. The Large size cover fits my MC perfectly. Overall I've been happy with the Dowco Guardian cover. I live in Florida and my MC is not garaged so the only protection it gets is the cover. The XL cover did a great job resisting sun and rain over the last year. The only problem was that it dropped and sagged so the lower part of the cover was always sandy which I didn't like. The new cover shouldn't have that problem. It also comes with a lifetime guarantee. I highly recommend this cover.
customer_reviews.author: KendallTom

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: The Dowco cover I had for my sports bike was great, but the new one I have for my cruiser is practically pointless. Definitely not waterproof... it rarely rains in CA but even with light rain when I pulled the cover off there was water all over the tank and seat. Also a seal on the inside is already coming off, and I’ve only had the cover for a month. Very disappointed, I’ll either be asking for a replacement or switching brands all together. My nice matte black paint now has water spots all over it... not cool, especially for the price. I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Cupps

customer_reviews.title: Fits my BMW K1600GT
customer_reviews.text: The cover was well marked and though I was concerned it would not fit my BMW K1600GT with the rear trunk it fit just fine. Finding the strap that connects under the bike was a bit of a challenge so ideally those straps would be another color or the buckles could be another color to make them easier to locate. All and all a good purchase and met my needs fine, though the bike does not sit outside, but inside a parking garage at the airport so I can't say much about weather resistance or how waterproof it really is.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Marin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit a 2017 Bonneville T100 well.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a high-quality product. Despite buying the model/size recommended by the manufacturer, it's just the wrong shape for my motorcycle. It's too tight across the mirrors and pulls them out of alignment. It also has tons of extra fabric (presumably for a windscreen -- which I don't have) which droops loosely and forms a "swimming pool" over the gas tank. The vent ends up hanging upside-down and is positioned so that it will let rain in. Maybe someday I'll excise some of the extra material from above the gas tank and use to add some gussets to allow it to fit over the mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Gentoo Guy

customer_reviews.title: Promotes Condensation, Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This cover promotes condensation and traps in the moisture, contrary to the manufacturer's claims. Every morning my motorcycle is covered in moisture from front to back, and the weather has been mild. I need to remove the cover to let the bike dry, and clean off the water spots, everyday. Moisture is the enemy. Your bike is better off without this cover.
customer_reviews.author: RSacky

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you store your bike outside!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cover. It keep pollen and other wind blown debris off my car. It definitely helps with rain. It's not totally waterproof mind you, in the sense that in a good rainfall the bike will still get damp underneath, but I feel way better with this thing on my bike than those other cheap, thin covers. This cover is relatively heavy, and made from a quality feeling material (it's thick). For only $20 you can get the alarm that fits into the pockets on the inside of the cover, which I highly recommend for something someone could casually take off your bike at night time (Sadly I've seen way cheaper covers stolen)
customer_reviews.author: Christian S.

customer_reviews.title: Great cover, worth the money if you are worried about this sort of thing
customer_reviews.text: Works well for keeping your bike covered, whether it be any kind of weather. I do slightly worry when the winds get too high, as it balloons up sometimes and may seem to help the wind knock over the bike, but it hasn't actually knocked over yet, and it will be for sure different based on the bikes shape. Latches underneath so it doesn't fly off too. Black with grey slices for specific sides. And rolls up, although is a little hard to do so, it's possible. With all that said, i won't ever throw this thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Cover for Apartment Life
customer_reviews.text: The fitment was as described; the cover has been rain and wind tested and passed with flying colors. I would recommend this cover to anyone keeping their motorcycle outside [apartment living]. The stuff sack, used for storage of the cover, is extremely nice. I like the fact that I can "strap" it to the back of the bike for extended roadtrips, so that it does not take up valuable storage space for clothing and sundries in my saddlebags. It appears to be well made. If I have an issue, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cover. I don't have anywhere to store my bike but in the driveway. When I uncovered my bike after three months of cold weather the bike looked like it'd never been outside sitting through sun, wind, rain, and snow. I did have some leaves and dust accumulated in my wheel spokes but I am very pleased with how this cover performed. It's a little dirty looking now but I read that a hosedown is an appropriate cleaning method.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bright

customer_reviews.title: First impression..
customer_reviews.text: Cover looks sturdy but I'm not sure how well made.. After doing a quick fit check, I went to place everything back into the compression sack. Right when I was about to finish, the handle on the compression sack gave way. Ugh. Instead of returning it through their "warrantee program" I'm returning to Amazon. Maybe I'd do that if I'v had it for a year but day one is a bit much to pay $10 return shipping.. Will update once I get some good use in. (Covering an 1150GS with top and side boxes)
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cover. Thick and strong. Gets very hot in the sun - the bike cooks underneath. Had to put an 88 cent mylar space blanket over it. Revised 4/20/19. Knocking off three stars. I discovered that the back portion has a cloth lining to keep it from melting if it touches the exhaust. The problem is, this lining gets wet whenever it rains. And it stays wet unless you take the cover off and dry it in the sun. So, instead of keeping the bike dry, this cover does the worst possible thing. It keeps the bike wet.
customer_reviews.author: Tatanta

customer_reviews.title: It’s all in the seams, and by all I mean not much.
customer_reviews.text: Originally I rated this five stars. Today it loses a star because I noticed that waterproof tape on the seams is starting to peel off. There are two 1 foot sections of the tape that have come completely off while large areas are on the verge of peeling. This somewhat annoys me. Guess I’ll have to hit the camping gear for some seam sealer and do it myself. I haven’t even had the cover a full month yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lee J. Eden

customer_reviews.title: No heat shields
customer_reviews.text: I've used Dowco covers in the past, and the weatherall covers all had the aluminized heat shields on the sides so you could put the cover on a (relatively) hot bike if necessary. The cover in the picture on Amazon shows this, but when my cover arrived, no heat shields were in place. I checked the item number on the box, and on the tag on the cover itself, and everything matches, so I guess Amazon delivered as promised, but for some reason Dowco has failed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof, actually collects moisture.
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! While the workmanship looked good, the design is very poor. The lower silver heat-resistant panels are NOT waterproof and wick and retain moisture keeping your mufflers wet. The vents are inadequate, and combined with the wicking issue noted above, allow condensation to form inside the cover and get the rest of the bike wet. My bike stayed dryer with the old leaking cover. What a profound disappointment. If you are trying to keep your bike dry in wet weather, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty!
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, quality, heavyweight materials. I've had this motorcycle cover for going on 5 years (purchased June 2015 for my 2005 zx-6r) and in that time it has spent 2 winters outside (15-16, and again 19-20) both years it accumulated snow and ice and came out of winter undamaged. It has also protected the bike from sun damage in the summer months. I would absolutely buy this cover again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Dowco Guardian 50005-07 Waterproof Motorcycle Cover:
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the motorcycle cover outdoors for about six weeks. The cover does a great job protecting my bike from rain and sun. It has held up to the weather so far, not showing signs of deterioration. The only complaint I have is there is no protective material on the underside over the windscreen as advertised. This would cause excessive ware as the cover moves in the wind. It is one of the better motorcycle covers I have used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and snug fit
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and made to fit. When I say “made to fit” I mean it; there is no slip in this thing and it’s actually a bit of work to get on. It’s even designed so that you have to have the wheel turned into the lock position or else it won’t fit. It’s already worked well for me in snow and rain so I’m pretty pleased overall. Just plan on an extra minute or two to get it on your bike and you’ll be happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Ive used this since about March on 2 different motorcycles. Overall the material of the cover is amazing compared to others ive looked at cant speak on its resistance levels aside from heat since my bike isnt kept in the elements. My only complaint with the cover is that one of the times i was putting the cover on after riding my pipe caught the strap that locks the cover to the bike and completely melted it off. Probably could've been avoided had i paid attention but for a $90 cover they could probably use something similar to the material that the cover is to make the strap so it would be a bit more heat resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: High quality but not completely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: After about 3 months of use, it appears to be high quality but: 1) It is not completely waterproof, particularly where the cover touches or lays tightly against a surface like the rear seat. If there is more than a light, brief drizzle, the seat gets soaked. I can see no holes, tears or places water can get in. 2) A lesser issue is that the cover does not completely fit the bike (which is on the small side, Kawasaki Ninja 400), so water splashes up from underneath and travels up by absorption from the inside during very heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Better than th rest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement cover for another brand that lasted a year. Definitely worth getting. Cover hugs your bike and is relatively water resistant. Dowco claims you can increase this by spraying a 3M water repellant product. Has a ventilation port to air out any odors and let in air. Reflective Dowco logo on the side. Big enough to cover both your bike and any sissy bars or accessories.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Fits BMW C650gt with top box and Honda Silverwing with top box
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy cover. Fits my BMW C650gt with top box great. Sprayed it down with Scotchgard water and sun shield as my old cover died from the sun. I will follow up with how it holds up, as my bike is parked in the sun all day, every day down in Florida. My biggest fear when I ordered this cover is if would fit right, and it does. It was impossible to find anyone to tell me if it would fit, since I have a top box. It will fit my Honda Silverwing with top box too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: XXXL Cover fits Victory Vision Tour
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Dowco cover. Each has given solid service in all weather, with a life-span of about three years. I recently purchased a Victory Vision Tour motorcycle, which probably has the longest span between tip to tail of any standard touring motorcycle. The XXXL fits well, covering entire bike to the ground. Only downside to this point is that it takes a bit of wrestling around with this oversized cover to get it on. But if you have a really big motorcycle, I guess you have to expect that. I'm hoping that a little more practice will make the process easier.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier Writer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good cover.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice cover. A bit thinner than what I'm used to seeing. It fit snugly per their chart. doesn't completely cover the front tire, but I haven't had a cover, that fit, that does. I like the attached strap, and the elastic, holds it firmly in place although it does make it harder to put on. I've only had it a short while but it has kept the bike dry, and dust free so far. I don't know how long it will last, or how well they will honor their warranty. I'll update when I have more info.
customer_reviews.author: Shuffle

customer_reviews.title: Also don't recommend trying to put this on the first time in ...
customer_reviews.text: Rain runs right off of this!! except at the seat where water tends to pool since there is no center support... BUT ~ even sitting in water for a day, I got home from work, dumped the water off & my seat under the cover was still dry!! Also don't recommend trying to put this on the first time in the dark with nothing but a porch light to go by... wasn't on too straight but still covered the bike. Love it, though... wish I bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!! Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't waterproof. Had the cover less than a week and we had a few days of rain in a row. Went out for a ride when it finally cleared up and the bike was wet! Seat, tank, everything! You can see where water soaks into the material. For the price, I can't imagine how they could make a product that isn't waterproof. It's just water "resistant". Works better as a dust cover in a garage.
customer_reviews.author: Lou L.

customer_reviews.title: Guardian By Dowco - WeatherAll Plus...still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: Product purchase update- it's been four years since I purchased this MC cover for my ZX14 so I thought I'd put up an update: totally worth every cent I spent. This cover has gone through four hard New England winters and is still in great shape. No bad seams, tears or softening of the elastic. I paid $78.30 at the time, should have bought another one for my ZX11. Disclaimer: I don't know anyone at Dowco, have not talked to anyone at Dowco. Just a consumer...
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Parris

customer_reviews.title: Elastic bands make pull your kickstand out
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the last pic is too strong it pulled my kickstand out from under my new bike and drop it to the groundbreaking one of my tail lights I think the company should you drawstrings like some of the other ones because elastic it makes it very hard to get on because it's so scrunched up. It's also very hard to get off because it's always trying to wrap around anything on your bike that sticks out even a little so you walk around your bike like eight times to get it off. But overall it works great against the weather and moisture and sunshine I just wish they would rethink their elastic bands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Indian Scout 16-18 Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I bought this cover. Folks said the cover offered by Indian for twice the price did not fit the Scout well, so I looked around and found this excellent cover. It fits a 2016 Indian Scout with taller, reduced reach, handlebars very well so it should fit any recent model Scout. I’m not sure if the factory cover from Indian is all nylon but that would be a problem with the Scout, whos pipes get pretty hot and stay hot. This cover has planned for that and has gray cotton inserts to keep hot metal from melting to the cover. I’d recommend this cover and buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz H.

customer_reviews.title: Fit is way off
customer_reviews.text: I chatted with the rep from Dowco. I told rep I have a Suzuki DL650 V Strom with a windshield AND a top case. He or she told me to get XL. The XL is too small. It does not cover the rear of the motorcycle leaving the sprocket and chain and part of the rear brake exposed. It is a well designed cover although it is not worth the price. As for the heat resistance I do not know for sure how well it works, I would let the bike cool down before covering.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great, but  there is a better one
customer_reviews.text: My previous one has a rear zipper. This model did not. I returned it. The one without zipper is difficult to put on and take off. When riding long multi-day rides, I always cover my bike to hide it. This means the cover goes on and off every day. The zipper model makes this so much easier, and allows access to the rear of the bike when you need to get to that area.
customer_reviews.author: Click Mann

customer_reviews.title: Improved over previous years!
customer_reviews.text: Dowci finally made this out of one durable fabric which will last years! Over the years I've bought three of these. But the previous years the bottom half was a grey fabric and that grey fabric would rot and fall apart. The upper black fabric would last forever. So I am confident that this one will last a long, long time. I guess the minus is that it is no longer two-toned and less visible.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peter Zuroff

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2016 sportster. The large is a little big, but that just means it covers my bike completely so not even my tires get wet. I've bought 2 and both seem to have held up fine the last few years. Also comes with a sick carrying case great for strapping onto the back of your bike on a road trip to hold clothes and whatnot. Would buy again just to have another one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Imperio

customer_reviews.title: Leaves scratches and scuffs
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a few months now. Will give it only 3 starts. The seams inside are very rough and it scratched both fenders on my very expensive bike. Very disappointing, now i have to repaint the fenders. Maybe a good rain protection, but your may get scuffs where these "Double Taped Seams" land. UPDATE: Seller compensated me the cover price to make the things right.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Kadulenkov

customer_reviews.title: Great bike cover.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cover for my wife's 2008 Victory Vegas. I used the Dowco fitment chart which recommended a size Large for her bike, so that's what I ordered. Item arrived fast. However, when I fit it to her bike, it was too small and not fully covering her pegs and only half of both wheels. Returned the item and ordered a size XL; it arrived and fitment was perfect for her bike. We have had this cover on her Vegas, outside in the elements, for over six months and no complaints. Particularly like the built in tie down strap and buckle for keeping the cover in place in windy conditions. Recommend, but watch that fitment.
customer_reviews.author: Hook026

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a large per the size chart, said it fit my bike. It is way too tight. It fits ok if I remove my windshield and rear seat, otherwise it does not cover the full bike. The other problem with being too tight is it risks damaging my lights and mirrors unless I remove it extremely carefully. It's already broken one light, lesson learned the hard way. I wish I returned this and bought an extra large. I have a 2012 V Star 950.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical but love this cover for my Harley...
customer_reviews.text: 2014 Harley Road King with back-rest and back luggage case...this size fits great! Great water/weather resistance and is holding up very well. Heavy duty...not like some of the other ones that say this...yet fit in a small travel bag it comes with. Now...I'm not sure I'll be able to get it back in the but doesn't matter...it's just what I wanted/needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: 5/5 Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have a 2013 Victory Cross Country tour and the XXXL fits perfectly. I've only used it a couple of times but this totally keeps my bike dry in wet weather and I'm sure will protect from dust in the off season. The quality of this item feels top notch, it seems really durable I'm stoked to be able to use this. It's quite a bit bigger than I might have initially thought (think small sleeping bag size almost). That said for an every day carry in the side luggage of my Vic, this thing will work awesome for me. 5/5 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 2006 BMW R1200RT
customer_reviews.text: Just got the cover so cant speak to the water proofness, but my old Dowco cover I am replacing did a great job for many years and I expect this to be just as good. I bought a Large, and it fits perfectly over my BMW R1200RT, without the panniers or top case on. Which is fine for me, since I only put them on when I am doing overnight trips. However, if you are looking to store your RT with you panniers on, you will need a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald F. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit a BMW R1200RT, but very nice cover
customer_reviews.text: Amazon said this (medium) is the right size cover for our BMW R1200RT, but it's not true. However, we have another bike that needs a cover and this is the right size. Dowco covers are very nice and last a long time in spite of being out in the weather 24/7. Buying another one in the right size for the BMW!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: The heat-seal waterproofing tap pulled off during transport
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, fits well. Does NOT hold up to the rigors of towing. I purchased this for my Harley heritage to protect my bike when I towed it from San Diego. When we got to about Medford Oregon, I noticed that 90% of the heat seal tape had peeled away from the seams. This was and unfortunate surprise because of the high ratings it had across several forums.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Fits Ducati Scrambler nicely - very durable
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Ducati Scrambler Full Throttle nicely - my one gripe is that there isn't decaling or coloring to immediately indicate "front" or "back" but I figure it out based on the location of the vent. The stuff sack it comes with is very helpful for storing it quickly on ride days. This is by no means a "portable" cover however - it's bulky even when in the stuff sack. The cover is very durable and I've had no issues with it so far in terms of melting or tearing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting the right size for your bike.
customer_reviews.text: Need better fittment guide. Amazon knows my bike is a 2003 Honda VT1100C2 cruiser and the banner at the top of the page says a size large will fit my bike. It doesn’t so I’m returning it and ordering an extra large which, by the way, the banner says will not fit. Otherwise, I think the product is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rocksterr

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof, heavy, and more than most will need.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: everything they say is true. It's excellent protection for your steed when you don't have a garage. The elastic is very strong and stays on. Cons: it is not lightweight or compact. It's a little unruly to put on as the elastic is quite strong. Honestly it's too much cover for my needs and not an option to bring with you on a trip as my sleeping bag packs down smaller. The large fits my vulcan 900 custom with saddle bags... But just barely. I would order an XL for ease of use and reduced strain on my mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Kerre J. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and good sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Dowco quality never fails. Well worth the cost over cheaper thinner covers. I used one of these to protect my Harley FXDL through Florida sun and rain for a couple years with great results. This new XXL fits my Harley Electra Glide touring motorcycle with tour park perfectly. The only complaint is the lack of an antenna hole, or at least I haven't found it yet.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: the good is that it keeps your bike dry and the ...
customer_reviews.text: this cover has its goods and bads. the good is that it keeps your bike dry and the elastic base means that it wont blow away in the wind. i dropped a star because the plastic strips that run along the seams will catch on any and every jagged edge on your bike and pull away from the cover. i have had to cut off a good amount of the plastic seams on the inside so it doesnt pull off any more. its a quality cover, but the design flaws are hard to come to terms with.
customer_reviews.author: kelso

customer_reviews.title: Quality cover for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It fits well enough on my FZ-07 with bar-end mirrors, though it's a little baggy in areas. My bike stays mostly covered by a carport, so I don't have to worry about water pooling in it anywhere, but if your bike spends a lot of time completely uncovered you should make sure to apply waterproofing agent to the cover every few months, especially to areas that a cover is baggy on it.
customer_reviews.author: Bass and car enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof ?
customer_reviews.text: Seems to allow a lot of condensation to form. Bike is almost as wet under cover as amount that has collected on top of cover. Haven't had rain yet so don't know how much would actually get through. I ride bike daily so I dry off condensate that collects, but if you don't use your bike that often it could help the rust process by allowing moisture to collect underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Bars n Guitarz

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2014 ninja 300 perfectly. This is not the same one Revzilla sells at $90 despite having the same name. This one is a lesser/older model. I haven't found anything to complain about though. I have yet to leave my bike in the rain, but it's doing a great job shielding my bike from the flock of terrorist birds in my neighborhood. It is also low profile, which is what you want to keep away thieves interest. I would recommend this to anyone looking for quality cover for their sports motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Hell of a motorcycle cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dowco cover in May of 2014 it is now April of 2019 it's been a great cover it's lost some of its water resistance in the last year and I just got the first tear over my mirror at the stitching and I parked my bike outside the entire time hell of a cover. I also lost one side of my strap about a year-and-a-half ago, minimal fading for direct sunlight. This is as honest as I can be I'm about to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Beacon77

customer_reviews.title: Not anywhere close to lifetime guarantee
customer_reviews.text: The identical one I bought on May 22, 2018, didn't last but 2 years plus, before the stitching gave way and ripped open the panels. I bought another because cheap ones deteriorate faster. Still, if all say lifetime guarantee, then none are. I don't want a hassle and excuses. But I can warn other people.
customer_reviews.author: Mark1VietVet

customer_reviews.title: High quality, good fit.
customer_reviews.text: This cover fit my 1980 BMW R65 with a Vetter fairing, Krauser bags, and a KG trunk. The R65 has a smaller wheelbase than the larger BMW Airheads, so it might fit the larger bikes as well. The cover rolls up into a high quality stuff sack which secures it to be strapped onto the bike when traveling. I would buy this cover again, if I have to, hopefully many years from now.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Not for a stock grom
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a cover for my grom since I live near the ocean, but this cover isn't working out. I didn't think it would be such a tight fit considering the grom comes with mirrors that stick pretty far out. There's no way to use the Grom size cover without messing up my mirrors everyday. It has, at least, kept the seat dry from morning dew and the few showers we actually get. A shame I wasted so much on this cover, but I'll modify it to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Eye See

customer_reviews.title: Great Sun and Short-Term Rain Protection
customer_reviews.text: Only soft cover to buy as far as I'm concerned. It's thick and great for both sun and rain protection. I'd never leave my two-wheeled child outside for long periods but if I'm zipping to work and the sky decides it's a great time to open up, my baby is protected. The clasp that goes under the tank makes it even more secure so wind can't inadvertently pull it off. There is a place where you can put an alarm on it but like I said I'm not storing my bike under it so it's unneeded for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Living in an apartment I have to keep my bike outside so having all the protection I can get is very nice. This cover keeps most of the elements off ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second cover of this type I've had. The first was a hand me down from a friends uncle. Having a brand new one that is the correct size for my bike helps add a lot of protection. Living in an apartment I have to keep my bike outside so having all the protection I can get is very nice. This cover keeps most of the elements off the bike, sometimes the wetness from heavy florida rains will get the bike wet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dowco recommended waiting 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Amazon add states: "Heat sealed double taped seams and heat shields allow immediate use after riding." The manufacturer's manual sheet seemed to hedge on that a bit - I'd give the exact quote but can't find my copy of the manual. I have no real gripe other than say what you mean and mean what you say at this time. Dowco recommended waiting 5 minutes, if my memory is correct. I haven't burned it yet, but I do wait the 5minutes since the cover is fairly pricey. The cove is very well made in other respects.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dowco Guardian Size Large for 2008 Suzuki M50 Boulevard
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dowco Guardian motorcycle cover in size large for my 2008 Suzuki M50 Boulevard. I also have a windshield and saddle bags on the bike and the cover fits great. We recently had a huge downpour with major gusty winds and this cover worked really well. Running a Python lock cable through the tie downs at the bottom center of the cover. The cover fabric is much heavier than expected too...so I am very happy with the design and my purchase. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great cover. Will buy again in another decade once this one tires out.
customer_reviews.text: This motorcycle cover is AWESOME. One entire summer under the Georgia sun and this thing hasn't faded a bit. You can feel how durable this thing is because it's thick and doesn't feel like a slick, nylon bedsheet like a few other covers I've tried. After over 6 months of use the only thing it could use is a quick coat of waterproofing. In a quick rain or in the morning dew it still keeps the bike perfectly dry. I laugh at my poor neighbor every time I see his flimsy, faded, excuse for a motorcycle cover. Don't be like my neighbor, spend a few extra bucks and get yourself a quality cover which will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: given that I am reviewing the cover (and not Amazon) I have to sat that it is of superior quality and thickness
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 2012-2018 Does NOT fit the Kawasaki ZX-14R Ninja AT ALL despite what Amazon suggested. The bike is much longer than the cover itself and there is no way you can get it to cover the motorcycle. However, given that I am reviewing the cover (and not Amazon) I have to sat that it is of superior quality and thickness. I also likes that the elastic part stretches all the way around the base of the cover creating a snug fit at the base of the motorcycle. I just have to return it because it wont cover the entire motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Performance
customer_reviews.text: I live in Colorado and have one of these on a motorcycle that I have outside in the burbs of Denver and in the Mountains at 8300 feet. Both protect the motorcycles from snow and ice throughout the Colorado winters. Excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Dowco Cover is Very Good
customer_reviews.text: This cover is very good and well worth the money! I keep my bike outside 8 of the 12 months and it protects from the elements very well. It is a breathable cover so you won't have any problems with moisture. Used this cover for 4 years and never had a problem with any rust. Just recently had to replace it after 4 years after I noticed a little moisture starting to get in, but 4 years of use is pretty good if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle cover
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cover. Fits rather large but is very easy to put on my Harley Davidson Springer and covers everything down to the ground. So far it is holding up nicely to the sun (living Hawaii and bikes are parked in the sun 100%). 100% satisfied!.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Outside might be waterproof but he inside creates condensation.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during the summer and I thought it was great. Once the temperature started coming down, I realized how much it sucks. It creates condensation and the bike becomes wet, and that is not even with rain. I took the temperature of the engine just to make sure it was not hot. See the pictures to know what I am talking about. This thing is dripping on the inside, and that is with out it raining.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why Amazon insists that this cover wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why Amazon insists that this cover wouldn't fit my 2012 Triumph Bonneville. Going to Dowco's actual website and using the fit guide helped me decide on the correct size (medium). It fits with both the stock retro mickey mouse ear mirrors and some recently purchased bar end mirrors. Sometimes it helps just to see your bike's name here with a review specifying the correct size. You're welcome potential bonneville riding reader.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Use a Hefty garbage bag instead
customer_reviews.text: My bike is 7 years old, and I baby it. That said, I used this cover outside in the beginning of the summer. The built up condensation was so bad, paint started to flake off my exhaust pipes! Where’s the great ventilation I read about??????
customer_reviews.author: beach bum

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, but be careful about the fit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality cover and I'm happy with the purchase. However, I have a 2015 Harley Road Glide Special (No box behind the passenger backrest) and the first cover I order was a size XL. The XL was too small for my bike so I returned it and ordered the XXL. The XXL fits my bike perfectly. This may help you to order the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G Kelsay

customer_reviews.title: Still protecting my bike after almost 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: This cover has been fantastic. I live in Northern Nevada where the sun is intense and the winters are brutal, and this cover has protected my bike from all of it. My bike lives outside so a good cover is essential. I have a DR-400 and once i lay the mirrors flat the cover fits great all the way to the ground around the whole bike. The heat resistant fabric seems to be holding up well, too, but I usually let the bike cool for a bit before covering.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and seem very durable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty heavy duty fabric. Feels high quality and like it will last a long time. I like the grey too so the bike isnt roasting under a black cover in the TN summer sun. Bike has stayed dry and out of the elements. Great product for a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hey, It Fits!
customer_reviews.text: It fits nicely on my 2008 Honda Shadow Spirit 750. Just got it so I can't comment on the heat and water resistance. Took me a few minutes to figure out the holes on the sides but the front pegs fit through them. I'm impressed with the fit. My one nitpick is that it could've come with better instructions. Overall I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: CEBrown

customer_reviews.title: Get a size bigger than you think you’ll need.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an amazing cover, absolutely incredible for the price it’s going for. And I went to the website to get the right size chart and all for my bike. It arrived and seemed to fit like a charm but I then realized it was far too small to fit comfortably over both saddlebags when they are on. Slightly disappointed in that but overwhelming satisfied with the rest of the aspects.
customer_reviews.author: The Jack

customer_reviews.title: Dowco is the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to ho on my new Harley. I loved the last one so much I couldn't find myself buying another brand. The old one was just too small for my new bike. Excellent product, that rolls up into a small, easy to store package.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen King

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fits strange.
customer_reviews.text: Product is a little strange to fit correctly on the bike as it doesn’t seem to have a front or a back....., I have an older Dowco for my KTM and it has a dowco badge on the front of it to make putting it on quickly when bad weather is coming easy. The product functions well and does it’s job, just figure out how it fits best before you need it to protect the bike 😊
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and very durable. My bike stays outside and I have used other covers. Most fade quickly and dont keep water out. This hasnt faded and it water tight. Bought for a stock road king. The size I purchased wouldn't be big enough with the windshield attached.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for under Rv 5th wheel storage
customer_reviews.text: We don't get much rain in W Texas so can't verify if it's waterproof plus I use it under a 5th wheel rv primary shaded and for dust protection So it definitely serves its purpose. Pretty good fit and feels like durable material. Just started using it at the turn of spring will update at the end of 100°+heat use in the lonestar
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: pretty heavy fabric
customer_reviews.text: It is as advertised. I bought the largest touring version, and it is just a tiny bit small for my tall windscreen bike with a top case on it. The cover only comes down the about the rear mud flap. I would have liked it about 12" taller.
customer_reviews.author: bh

customer_reviews.title: Replacement just as bad
customer_reviews.text: Falling apart at the seams literally Update 08/28/2020: Received warranty replacement cover on 6/22 been using everyday. Condensation under the cover after every rain day, botttom stays wet. When I take the cover off it’s completely soaked, where is the waterproofing? Not worth the premium price for the lack of quality you get
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the best cover I've ever owned. It fits my '13 HD Fat Boy Lo perfectly. It's made from a thick and durable material that keeps out the elements. I live in South Florida where we get some torrential storms, and this cover keeps my bike bone dry. It also protects well from dust and the corrosive effects of salt water. It's definitely worth the price if you really want something that provides real protection
customer_reviews.author: Dean R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a Vespa 49cc scooter
customer_reviews.text: Finally a cover that fits my Vespa ET2 perfectly! Material is heavy and durable and the elastic around the bottom holds it nicely in place. So happy with this cover!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cover, definite buy
customer_reviews.text: Best cover without breaking the bank. If you are hesitant or researching the different brands like I was I would definitely go with this as a solid stater. Cover has a quality and sturdy build and the features are very well thought out; from the vents to the cloth windvisor pad stitched towards to front to protect from scuffing. I primarily use mine as a theft deterrent in parking garages and a dust cover when stored in my garage but it seems it would stand up well to the elements if used for outdoors parking as well.
customer_reviews.author: wescom24

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection for my scoot
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy and well made. The XL size fits my 2014 Suzuki Burgman AN650 like a glove. It's been through several summer thunderstorms and lots of this summer's extreme heat and is doing fine. Great price on Amazon, great value!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harris

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be a high quality cover
customer_reviews.text: Just received it. Bought it for use with a V-Strom 650 (DL650) - (tall windshield, no saddlebags, small rear bag). Fits perfect. Looks to be very heavy duty. I am initially very pleased with the purchase. I will try and remember to update this after a year or more.
customer_reviews.author: Amatek

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof. Would be good as an indoor cover.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a waterproof cover, do not buy this. While it seems well made and fits well, the inside of the cover including the windshield protecting fabric at the top and the heat resistant fabric at the bottom are completely soaked after one moderate rain shower. This leaves both of the dash/instrument/gauge area and the lower portions of the bike from front to back in contact with wet material. I have found that I have to remove the cover and turn it inside out to air dry after every rain event. Would be very good as an indoor cover.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Dowco's website said that it would fit and it fits great, even with a sissy bar
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's fit guide says that this does not fit a 2015 Harley Davidson Street Glide Special BUT IT DOES!! Dowco's website said that it would fit and it fits great, even with a sissy bar. This cover ppears to be very heavy duty and may be a challenge trying to put it on alone because it is large. I couldn't imagine my husband riding to work and using this to block the suns rays, but it has been great for storage.
customer_reviews.author: bbsad1

customer_reviews.title: give it some thought if you have to cover a windshield and saddlebags like I did
customer_reviews.text: Although this particular size fits a HD Heritage Soft tail, I bought if for a Dyna Wide guide because for the windshield and saddlebags that I installed on the Dyna. Before you order a cover based on what the company suggests based on your type of motorcycle, give it some thought if you have to cover a windshield and saddlebags like I did. Dowco suggested a medium for my Dyna, but the x-large fits correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie L.

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: My husband is happy with this purchase. It covers his bike perfectly without any gaps and has a buckle to secure it through the tires. The elastic running keeps it secure around the bike so the wind doesn’t blow it up.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Finn

customer_reviews.title: Check the sizing
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these Guardian heavy duty covers for years on my Kawasaki Concours sport tour that lived outside except in winter. The quality and protection was great. Now time for a new one on my 2015 Harley Davidson Ultra Limited (FLHTK). Received it today, and was very pleased with the quality, but check the sizing carefully. My HD is completely stock. Stock windshield height, stock trunk. With the antennas removed, it does not cover down over the pipes at the rear. This was the XL size the web site said would my Ultra Limited. I think a larger size would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. Very sturdy material. Well constructed. It fits my bike very well. It stays put. I've had three other motorcycle covers and this is BY FAR, the best I've had. Was recommended by a local cycle shop. I'm glad I listened to their advice. It is well worth the extra money I spent on it. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. The first one lasted 2 years before starting to tear and deteriorate. Covering a Victory Octane with small saddle bags. It's a little big but the next size down was too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had the cover for a year now and definitely have had no complaints. I live in California so it hasn't been put to the test in regards to variability in climates. However, this was a great fit for my Ducati Monster 797. I like the bag that came with it, as well.
customer_reviews.author: afnav23

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit for my 2011 Harley Road Glide Ultra. Ordered the XXL. Have not had it in the rain yet. Will update if any issues. Nice cover and price. Comes with a storage bag that will compress cover using straps for saving storage space. Has wheel lock grommets, no lock supplied.
customer_reviews.author: joe langenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed cover
customer_reviews.text: The cover arrived sooner than expected, very well packaged, and appears exactly as described. It fits my motorcycle perfectly, as if it were custom designed specifically for it. It is easy to apply according to included instructions, and incorporates nice security features so that I am confident that my investment in the motorcycle will be well protected for years. I cannot, as of yet, answer the question of heat resistance, because I have not had occasion to use it under those conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Martin

customer_reviews.title: Cover is made of heavy duty material, should last a long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 2007 Moto Guzzi Griso and its fits perfect! Fits snug to the bike and stays put. Material is heavy duty and water rolls right off . I went through several cheap covers, dont waste your time with a "cheapo".
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Most of the Weather Out
customer_reviews.text: Seams are sealed with plastic tape, but tape detached after a few weeks. I was able to repair seams with an iron. One section of cover is not water resistant so sprayed with camping tent waterproofing. It fits my triumph tiger 800 well.
customer_reviews.author: DetailDevil66

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for a 09 yamaha r6
customer_reviews.text: First impression - a great quality cover. I had a "Nelson-Rigg MC-904-03-LG Deluxe All-Season Motorcycle Cover" - large size for my 08 Kawasaki Ninja 250. I purchased a 09 Yamaha yzf-r6 and the nelson rigg could barely cover it. Tires were still visible, felt really tight around the front. The Dowco fit the bike perfectly. The build quality was evident upon first touch - thicker fabric, stronger water resistant feel. The instructions were generic and mentioned not having the "non-silver" (heat treated) parts of the cover touch the exhaust but this cover doesn't have any silver parts - it's all black. Very pleased, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: sinophilic

customer_reviews.title: Great Scooter Cover
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2009 Vespa GTS and it fits it like a glove. It says on tight during a storm and keeps it nice and dry. This company makes quality covers that I would recommend to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D

customer_reviews.title: Best one.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and good material, solid and heavy (enough strong for the winter time) - probably the best in the market. But it's the second one I buy in 5 years - visibly the lifetime is between 3 and 5 years, after that, many small holes and sewing is destroying!
customer_reviews.author: tamsky

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I live near the sea and there are a ton of factors that can wear out my motorcycle. Since I bought this cover the bike has loved me for it. No more dew on the bike all night, or sea water filled air attacking any portion of it. Plus the sun can not get through at all. Fits my 2007 gsxr 600 perfectly! Very easy to put on and take off both the first few times and especially after the first few times.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyGDI

customer_reviews.title: Dowco Guardian motorcycle cover
customer_reviews.text: The Adventure size was just slightly too large for my KTM 790 Adventure R with Mosko 80 Reckless system in place, but I don't think the next smaller size would've have fit. Protects well and packs up nicely with the provided compression sack! Appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D.

product_meta.title: Dowco Guardian 50003-02 WeatherAll Plus Indoor/Outdoor Waterproof Motorcycle Cover: Black, Large
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:BlackThe Dowco 50003-02 WeatherAll Plus motorcycle cover is waterproof, breathable, and helps protect against rain, mildew, and fading caused by the sun's UV rays. Constructed of heavy-duty ClimaShield Plus fabric protection, a 300 Denier, and solution-dyed polyester fabric with a durable water-repellent top coat, it provides maximum rain and UV protection. The reflective Moisture-Guard vent system gives added nighttime visibility and allows for moisture to escape, preventing build-up under the cover. Features stitched seams that are taped to ensure maximum waterproofness as well as a polyurethane and mildew-resistant undercoating. A soft cotton protects the windshield and a heat shield is used to protect the cover from warm pipes, allowing immediate use after riding. An elastic shock cord and a polyester webbing belly strap are sewn into the bottom to provide a snug fit and prevent the cover from coming off in high winds. For added security, the cover includes a sewn-in hold for a wheel lock to be passed through, as well as a sewn-in alarm pocket for a Guardian Cover Alarm (sold separately). The Dowco 50003-02 WeatherAll Plus cover includes a compression storage back for easy, convenient transporting, and a limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Waterproof and breathable motorcycle cover that protects against rain, mildew, and fading caused by the sun's UV rays; Features heat shield against warm pipes
Made with ClimaShield Plus fabric protection, a 300 Denier, and solution-dyed polyester fabric with a durable water-repellent top coat; Soft cotton protects windshield
Reflective Moisture-Guard vent system prevents moisture build-up under the cover; Includes a polyurethane and mildew-resistant undercoating
Elastic shock cord is sewn into the bottom to provide a snug fit; Polyester webbing belly strap is sewn in to prevent the cover from coming off in high winds
Includes compression storage bag for transporting, a sewn-in hole for a wheel lock, and a sewn-in alarm pocket (alarm sold separately); Limited lifetime warranty

specifications.Model: DOWCO Guardian WeatherAll Plus Motorcycle Cover
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,350 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
